page.title: 16HOUSES IN DARLINGTON
page.content: Years ago this part of Darlington was country with country houses and farms owned by the wealthy families of the town. Down Pierrmont Road the houses were built about the 1920s to 30s they are mostly semi-detached. There are no gardens in the back they are all back lanes. Near the Methodist church in Cockerton the houses are very old they were built in the beginning of the nineteenth century. The houses dont have any gardens but they do have back lanes.Some of the houses are terraced. Most of the houses along Staindrop Road are pre-war they are semi-detached and have front and back gardens.Towards the edge of town the houses are very modern (Post-war) and semi-detached and have fairly big front and rear gardens.
